testprocedure.test-case-summary: This test procedure is called by a test case and is used to verify the SUTs support of the dlEventIndexSubscription dialog as an OC using variables provided by the calling test case. This procedure supports verification of requirements related to user need 2.3.3.1 [Need For An Index of Events] and is used for both valid and invalid test cases.

testStep.functionId: Step 1 CONFIGURE: Determine the Application Layer Standard that will be used for this test. RECORD this information as: ApplicationLayerStandard: ${ApplicationLayerStandard}

Step 2 CONFIGURE: Determine the dialog performance requirement for Publish Event Index Information (NTRM 3.3.3.9.2}. RECORD this value as: TMDD_N5R208_Publish_Event_Index_Information_Parameter = ${TMDD_N5R208_Publish_Event_Index_Information_Parameter}

Step 3 CONFIGURE: Determine the dialog performance requirement for Subscribe to Event Index Information (NTRM 3.3.3.9.3}. RECORD this value as: TMDD_N5R209_Subscribe_to_Event_Index_Information_Parameter = ${TMDD_N5R209_Subscribe_to_Event_Index_Information_Parameter}

Step 4 CONFIGURE: Determine whether Restrictions - Error Report is required by the specification. (NRTM 3.3.1.4.1.2.1). RECORD this information as: TMDD_N5R14_Restrictions___Error_Report_Supported = ${TMDD_N5R14_Restrictions___Error_Report_Supported}

Step 5 CONFIGURE: Determine whether Event URL File Update Date and Time Information is required by the specification. (NRTM 3.3.3.9.5.2.1). RECORD this information as: TMDD_N5R217_Event_URL_File_Update_Date_and_Time_Information_Supported = ${TMDD_N5R217_Event_URL_File_Update_Date_and_Time_Information_Supported}

Step 6 CONFIGURE: Determine whether Event URL Reference Medium is required by the specification. (NRTM 3.3.3.9.5.2.2). RECORD this information as: TMDD_N5R218_Event_URL_Reference_Medium_Supported = ${TMDD_N5R218_Event_URL_Reference_Medium_Supported}
Step 7 CONFIGURE: Determine the number of publication message transmissions that will be received within this test. RECORD this information as: PublicationsToReceive: ${PublicationsToReceive}
Step 8 CONFIGURE: Determine whether an error response message is expected for this test. RECORD this information as: PublicationErrorResponseExpected: ${PublicationErrorResponseExpected}

Step 9 CONFIGURE: IF PublicationErrorResponseExpected is true, determine the expected error code response for this test. RECORD this information as: PublicationErrorTypeExpected: ${PublicationErrorTypeExpected}
Step 10 CONFIGURE: Define the publication response message that will be sent to the SUT. RECORD this information as: PublicationResponseMessage: ${PublicationResponseMessage}
Step 11 CONFIGURE: Determine whether the Authentication parameters need to be verified within this test. RECORD this information as: AuthenticationCheck: ${AuthenticationCheck}
Step 12 CONFIGURE: Determine whether the SUT will be allowed access to the information requested in this test. RECORD this information as: AllowAccess: ${AllowAccess}
Step 13 CONFIGURE: Define the subscription message that will be sent to the SUT. RECORD this information as: SubscriptionMessage: ${SubscriptionMessage}
Step 14 CONFIGURE: Determine whether an error response message is expected for this test. RECORD this information as: SubscriptionErrorResponseExpected: ${SubscriptionErrorResponseExpected}

Step 15 CONFIGURE: IF SubscriptionErrorResponseExpected is true, determine the expected error code response for this test. RECORD this information as: SubscriptionErrorTypeExpected: ${SubscriptionErrorTypeExpected}

Step 16 SUBSCRIPTION-EC with the following parameters: DIALOG=dlEventIndexSubscription RESPONSETIMEREQUIRED= SUBSCRIPTIONMESSAGE = SubscriptionMessage SUBSCRIPTIONERRORRESPONSEEXPECTED = SubscriptionErrorResponseExpected SUBSCRIPTIONERRORTYPEEXPECTED = SubscriptionErrorTypeExpected Returns: CONTINUEPUBLICATION

Step 17 IF SubscriptionErrorResponseExpected is not equal to TRUE THEN CONTINUE, OTHERWISE skip the following substeps. Note: If a verification step fails, then test execution will proceed at the next subsequent Post Condition step, if present. Otherwise, test execution will proceed to the final Exit step.

Step 17.1 WHILE CONTINUEPUBLICATION is equal to TRUE then CONTINUE, OTHERWISE skip the following substeps. Note:If a verification step fails, then test execution will proceed at the next subsequent Post Condition step, if present. Otherwise, test execution will proceed to the final Exit step.

Step 17.1.1 PUBLICATION-EC-RECEIVE with the following parameters: DIALOG=dlEventIndexUpdate RESPONSETIMEREQUIRED=TMDD_N5R208_Publish_Event_Index_Information_Parameter PUBLICATIONSTORECEIVE = PublicationsToReceive PUBLICATIONERRORRESPONSEEXPECTED = PublicationErrorResponseExpected PUBLICATIONERRORTYPEEXPECTED = PublicationErrorTypeExpected AUTHENTICATIONCHECK = AuthenticationCheck ALLOWACCESS = AllowAccess Returns: CONTINUEPUBLICATION

Step 17.1.2 IF PublicationErrorResponseExpected is not equal to TRUE THEN CONTINUE, OTHERWISE skip the following substeps. Note: If a verification step fails, then test execution will proceed at the next subsequent Post Condition step, if present. Otherwise, test execution will proceed to the final Exit step.
Step 17.1.2.1 VERIFY that an eventIndexMsg message was received.
Step 17.1.2.2 VERIFY that a feu-url data frame exists within each instance of data frame eventIndexMsg.eventIndex
Step 17.1.2.3 VERIFY that an event-update-time data frame exists within each instance of data frame eventIndexMsg.eventIndex
Step 17.1.2.4 VERIFY that an event-id data element exists within each instance of data frame eventIndexMsg.eventIndex
Step 17.1.2.5 VERIFY that an event-update data element exists within each instance of data frame eventIndexMsg.eventIndex
Step 17.1.2.6 VERIFY that a status data element exists within each instance of data frame eventIndexMsg.eventIndex
Step 17.1.2.7 IF TMDD_N5R217_Event_URL_File_Update_Date_and_Time_Information_Supported is equal to TRUE THEN CONTINUE; OTHERWISE skip the following substeps.
Step 17.1.2.7.1 VERIFY that a file-update-time data frame exists within each instance of data frame eventIndexMsg.eventIndex
Step 17.1.2.8 IF TMDD_N5R218_Event_URL_Reference_Medium_Supported is equal to TRUE THEN CONTINUE; OTHERWISE skip the following substeps.
Step 17.1.2.8.1 VERIFY that an url-reference-medium data element exists within each instance of data frame eventIndexMsg.eventIndex.feu-url
Step 17.1.2.9 VERIFY that the values within the REQUEST message are correct per the TMDD standard and known operational conditions.

USER-VERIFY-MESSAGE.functionId: The User Verifies the message content

testStep.functionId: Step 17.1.2.10 CONFIGURE: Set CONTENTVERIFIED to True

Step 17.1.2.11 POSTCONDITION: PUBLICATION-EC-REPLY with the following parameters: DIALOG=dlEventIndexUpdate RESPONSETIMEREQUIRED=TMDD_N5R208_Publish_Event_Index_Information_Parameter CONTENTVERIFIED = CONTENTVERIFIED PUBLICATIONRESPONSEMESSAGE = PublicationResponseMessage

Step 18 IF SubscriptionErrorResponseExpected is equal to TRUE THEN CONTINUE, OTHERWISE skip the following substeps. If a verification step fails, then test execution will proceed at the next subsequent Post Condition step, if present. Otherwise, test execution will proceed to the final Exit step.
Step 18.1 VERIFY that an errorReportMsg message was received.
Step 18.2 VERIFY that an organization-information data frame exists within message errorReportMsg.
Step 18.3 VERIFY that an organization-requesting data frame exists within message errorReportMsg.
Step 18.4 VERIFY that an error-code data element exists within message errorReportMsg.
Step 18.5 VERIFY that an error-text data element exists within message errorReportMsg.
Step 18.6 VERIFY that data element error-code is set to SubscriptionErrorResponseTypeExpected.
Step 18.7 IF TMDD_N5R14_Restrictions___Error_Report_Supported is equal to TRUE THEN CONTINUE; OTHERWISE skip the following substeps.
Step 18.7.1 VERIFY that a restrictions data frame exists within message errorReportMsg.
Step 19 EXIT
